text.author: Cory Doctorow
text.summary: Author Cory Doctorow gives advice on how to be productive and get writing done despite distractions from the Internet such as IM or email by keeping a short, regular work schedule of at least 20 minutes of work daily, leaving oneself a 'rough edge' of unfinished work to resume the next day, not expecting a perfect work environment, and turning off realtime communication tools.
text.title: Writing in the Age of Distraction (in: 88 Open Essays - A Reader for Students of Composition & Rhetoric, Sarah Wangler & Tina Ulrich eds.)
